channel.title: News - South China Morning Post
channel.description: All the latest breaking news from Hong Kong, China and around the world

item.title: India’s rice export bans expected into 2024, in further hit to global prices
item.description: PM Narendra Modi has repeatedly tightened restrictions on shipments in a bid to curb domestic price rises and shield Indian consumers – prices surged to a 15-year high in August in response.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Chinese policy banks shut out green energy despite President Xi Jinping’s 2021 pledge to developing countries, study says
item.description: President Xi Jinping has pledged China would stop funding overseas coal and turn to green energy projects, but policy lenders have not followed suit, study says.
item.dc:creator: Jevans Nyabiage
item.author: Jevans Nyabiage

item.title: Hong Kong minibus driver, 75, dies after his parked vehicle slides forward, fatally striking him
item.description: Minibus slid down Sheung Wo Street and hit the driver, trapping him under vehicle, police say.
item.dc:creator: Connor Mycroft
item.author: Connor Mycroft

item.title: How Hong Kong’s new breed of ‘snake kings’ are defanging a cruel practice
item.description: For years, reptiles that slithered close to humans would be delivered by ‘snake kings’ to authorities and might languish in boxes for days, but newly licensed catchers are putting them back into the wild almost right away.
item.dc:creator: Lars Hamer
item.author: Lars Hamer

item.title: Maldives China-friendly president Mohamed Muizzu makes official request to India to withdraw military personnel
item.description: President Mohamed Muizzu, who is seen as pro-China, campaigned on a promise to evict Indian military personnel and balance trade, which he said was heavily in favour of India under his predecessor.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Is the Philippines nearing ‘destabilisation’ over the apparent Marcos-Duterte clan feud?
item.description: A top general has warned of ‘destabilisation efforts’ instigated by former officers against President Ferdinand Marcos Jnr.
item.dc:creator: Raissa Robles
item.author: Raissa Robles

item.title: Operation Santa Claus: project to help Hong Kong victims of sex abuse win justice to benefit from fundraising drive support
item.description: RainLily, city’s first sexual violence crisis centre, says statistics show one in seven women have experienced sexual abuse.
item.dc:creator: Cindy Sui
item.author: Cindy Sui

item.title: Cross-strait tensions no hurdle for Taiwanese shoppers – if the price is right
item.description: Despite a precipitous decline in cross-strait relations, products from mainland China hold appeal for many shoppers in Taiwan as the mainland’s technological capacity sharpens and economies of scale keep retail prices low.
item.dc:creator: Ralph Jennings
item.author: Ralph Jennings

item.title: US denies report of Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal to free hostages; WHO says Gaza’s al-Shifa hospital ‘death zone’
item.description: The White House denied a report by The Washington Post of a US-brokered deal between Israel and Hamas to free some hostages in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse,Reuters
item.author: Agence France-Presse,Reuters

item.title: Abandon the ‘China threat’ talk or risk upset in China-US reset, former Beijing envoy says
item.description: Former senior diplomat Kong Xuanyou says it’s time to downplay competition to be the world’s top power.
item.dc:creator: Su-Lin Tan
item.author: Su-Lin Tan

item.title: Malaysia’s Penang hopes to hook Chinese medical tourists with healing holidays
item.description: Penang is intensifying efforts to attract Chinese medical tourists, aiming to increase revenue by offering diverse medical services and capitalising on its growing holiday destination reputation.
item.dc:creator: Randy Mulyanto
item.author: Randy Mulyanto

item.title: Philippines’ Marcos Jnr asks TikTok CEO Chew Zi Shou to help retailers promote products
item.description: Marcos Jnr wants the video app to train local sellers, especially those in rural areas, to market their offerings, after meeting with TikTok Chief Executive Officer Chew Zi Shou in San Francisco.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Busted: online China ‘scammer with a heart’ snared after sending US$23 lucky money gift to victim he conned out of US$40,000
item.description: Police in China have detained a gang of scammers after one of its members sent a victim a good fortune red envelope, leading investigators to the account holder.
item.dc:creator: Liya Su
item.author: Liya Su

item.title: ‘They fell through the cracks’: how can Hong Kong better help mentally disabled people and their carers? Parents, experts want wider safety net for high-risk residents
item.description: Case of mentally disabled adult brothers found dead at home shows ‘safety net needs to be tightened’, experts say.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun,Emily Hung
item.author: Fiona Sun,Emily Hung

item.title: China’s broadcasting regulator to increase control over country’s booming short web drama market
item.description: The National Radio and Television Administration has proposed a range of measures to ‘strengthen and refine management’ of short web dramas, including a sweeping review of each series’ cast, production, marketing and social values.
item.dc:creator: Ben Jiang
item.author: Ben Jiang

item.title: Xi Jinping warns top officials to contain political risks to avoid China’s economy, society being hit by ‘butterfly effect’
item.description: Chinese leader’s words to party members in an internal speech given earlier this year have been revealed.
item.dc:creator: Yuanyue Dang
item.author: Yuanyue Dang

item.title: Canada’s Michael Spavor blames fellow prisoner Michael Kovrig for China arrest
item.description: The consultant shared information with Kovrig, a report says, not knowing it would be relayed to the Canadian government and its Five Eyes intelligence partners.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: Joe Biden says Palestinian Authority should ultimately govern Gaza and West Bank after war with Israel
item.description: The US president said there should be no forcible displacement of Palestinians, no blockade and no reduction in territory after Israel’s operation.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Liberia’s President George Weah concedes election defeat to Joseph Boakai
item.description: The near-final results of the presidential run-off show the incumbent trailing his opposition challenger, who led with nearly 51 per cent of the vote.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Elderly Hong Kong woman tricked out of HK$16 million after giving out bank account details
item.description: Crime discovered in police crackdown on online scams involving HK$49.8 million in losses, with officers arresting 21 people.
item.dc:creator: Lo Hoi-ying
item.author: Lo Hoi-ying

item.title: SpaceX loses Starship on approach to space in test flight
item.description: SpaceX, known for its iterative approach to rocket development, is likely to view the overall flight as a success given the new milestones it achieved.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg
item.author: Bloomberg

item.title: 41 workers remain trapped in India tunnel for seventh day as drilling rescue hits snags
item.description: The workers have been trapped since Sunday when a landslide caused part of the tunnel they were building to collapse about 200 metres from the entrance.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: US, China need to engage more with developing Apec economies, trade chief of 2024 host nation Peru says
item.description: 2024 Apec host nation Peru is “open to business with the whole world”, trade and tourism minister Juan Carlos Mathews tells the Post, as he rejects US concerns over military implications for China’s belt and road role in Peruvian Port of Chancay.
item.dc:creator: Igor Patrick
item.author: Igor Patrick

item.title: Taylor Swift postpones show after fan’s death in Rio de Janeiro’s sweltering heat
item.description: Ana Clara Benevides, 23, fell ill at an earlier performance held in a record 59.3 degrees Celsius (138.7 degrees Fahrenheit) heat, and died later in hospital.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Hong Kong’s LGBTQ community won’t be hitting streets for annual pride event although ‘Journey with Rainbow GPS’ exhibition adds some colour
item.description: Hong Kong Pride Parade committee has organised an exhibition, a mini fair and guided tours in Kwun Tong with theme ‘A Journey with Rainbow GPS’.
item.dc:creator: Sammy Heung
item.author: Sammy Heung

item.title: First group of wounded Palestinian children from Israel-Gaza war arrives in UAE
item.description: The group of 15 people, including children and their family members, crossed the Gaza Strip’s Rafah border crossing with Egypt and took a flight from to Abu Dhabi.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Taiwan elections: KMT-TPP joint presidential ticket talks break down over technicality
item.description: The TPP’s Ko Wen-je says he can’t agree to the KMT’s calculation to decide who will be the top contender.
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Chung
item.author: Lawrence Chung

item.title: Number of Hong Kong undergraduates at US universities falls to record low amid ‘safety fears, poor Sino-US relations’
item.description: Number of first degree students from Hong Kong in US drops to just over 3,000, lowest figure since statistics became available in 2000.
item.dc:creator: William Yiu
item.author: William Yiu

item.title: China open to expert-level talks on seafood ban, Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida says after talks with Xi Jinping
item.description: Kishida says he called for ‘objective judgment’ on Japanese seafood when he discussed Fukushima waste water row with Xi last week, while Xi urges Japan to address ‘legitimate concerns’.
item.dc:creator: Jack Lau,Agence France-Presse
item.author: Jack Lau,Agence France-Presse

item.title: Maldives, with its new China-friendly president, expects boost in investment as Beijing looks to ‘seize the opportunity’
item.description: New Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu is considered more pro-China than his India-leaning predecessor, with collaboration in renewable energy projects seen to offer potential, according to a Hong Kong-based diplomat.
item.dc:creator: Ralph Jennings
item.author: Ralph Jennings

item.title: Hong Kong marine police rescue 4 suspected illegal immigrants spotted on tiny island
item.description: Force deploys patrol boat to rescue three of them from Peaked Hill, southwest of Lantau, while fourth, who was reportedly injured, airlifted off island.
item.dc:creator: Lo Hoi-ying
item.author: Lo Hoi-ying

item.title: South China Sea disputes should not define ties, Philippine leader Marcos tells China’s Xi at Apec
item.description: Run-ins in resource-rich waters have largely marred relations between rival claimants Beijing and Manila, prompting US to renew defence pledge.
item.dc:creator: Jack Lau,Dewey Sim
item.author: Jack Lau,Dewey Sim

item.title: Hongkongers nip over to mainland China to save on hairy crabs, with some sellers offering to deliver seasonal delicacy
item.description: Residents drawn by price, freshness and wide variety can also have their crabs cooked on the spot in Shenzhen supermarket.
item.dc:creator: Lo Hoi-ying
item.author: Lo Hoi-ying

item.title: ‘This is too funny’: sleepy China burglar dozes off mid-robbery, loud snoring wakes up homeowner who calls police
item.description: Police have detained a bungling burglar in China after he fell asleep during a break-in and woke the homeowner with his loud snoring.
item.dc:creator: Yating Yang
item.author: Yating Yang

item.title: Finance chief Paul Chan updates Chinese President Xi Jinping on Hong Kong’s situation at Apec summit
item.description: ‘I mentioned that since the new government took office, strengthening the economy and improving people’s livelihood have been our top priorities,’ minister says.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Sun
item.author: Fiona Sun

item.title: Hundreds flee as Israel orders Gaza’s al-Shifa main hospital evacuated
item.description: Israel has been pressing military operations inside the hospital, searching for the Hamas operations centre it says lies under the sprawling complex.
item.dc:creator: Agence France-Presse
item.author: Agence France-Presse

item.title: Hong Kong’s 170,000 civil servants are ‘duty-bound’ to vote in district council election, 2 senior officials say
item.description: No 2 official Eric Chan and deputy Warner Cheuk call on government workers to cast ballots in first district council race held under Beijing’s electoral overhaul.
item.dc:creator: Emily Hung,Fiona Chow
item.author: Emily Hung,Fiona Chow

item.title: Israel-Gaza war: don’t rewrite the past and ignore Hamas’ brutality
item.description: Israel’s restrictions on Gaza did not give rise to the violence; it was violence that made the restrictions necessary in the first place.The first step to a better future is getting history right and freeing the Gaza Strip of Hamas control.
item.dc:creator: Amir Lati
item.author: Amir Lati

item.title: The ‘Asian tiger’ who took on Donald Trump: Singapore tycoon Kwek Leng Beng shares how he bought and sold Plaza Hotel in new biography
item.description: In Strictly Business: The Kwek Leng Beng Story, the Singaporean tycoon opens up on his six decades in business and the lessons he learnt through crises and challenges.
item.dc:creator: An excerpt
item.author: An excerpt

item.title: US team retracts bombshell superconductor study after Chinese researchers challenge findings
item.description: Science journal Nature has retracted a paper by a team of US scientists which claimed to have created a room-temperature superconducting material.
item.dc:creator: Ling Xin
item.author: Ling Xin

item.title: Israel-Gaza war: Biden aide says ‘significant’ pause in fighting possible if Hamas frees hostages
item.description: Brett McGurk, Biden’s top adviser on the Middle East, told a Bahrain security summit that there will be a ‘significant change’ if the captives are released.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Malaysia hotel steps up security after Singapore family says man entered room at 3am
item.description: A woman claimed the intruder left after saying he had ‘entered the wrong room’ where she was staying with her husband and toddler.
item.dc:creator: TODAY
item.author: TODAY

item.title: Rice, rice, maybe? Asia’s middle class seek out low-carb alternatives
item.description: The shift towards healthier living and eating habits has blossomed into a robust market today aimed at those who can afford it.
item.dc:creator: Kimberly Lim,Amy Sood
item.author: Kimberly Lim,Amy Sood

item.title: ‘Trying to force us to leave’: China tenant turns balcony into funeral hall to ruin business of store below because of humming refrigerator
item.description: A man in China placed funeral decorations on his balcony to sabotage the ground-floor grocery store business because of the shop’s refrigerator noise.
item.dc:creator: Alice Yan
item.author: Alice Yan

item.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs and ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura settle sex trafficking, rape lawsuit
item.description: The rapper and Ventura settled the lawsuit alleging sex slavery and rape one day after she sued the influential music producer.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Israel-Gaza war: Western failure to see new realities thwarts peace
item.description: Arab governments want the US to understand that popular outrage could undermine the normalising of relations with Israel and spark anti-Western movements. Grasping this is essential for Washington as youth and minority voters are increasingly sympathetic to the suffering of Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: Amr El Henawy
item.author: Amr El Henawy

item.title: ‘Apathy’ in the air: Hong Kong district council hopefuls wheel out meek messages, empty slogans as overhauled election approaches
item.description: ‘Rival candidates’ from same party share similar campaign messages, Post check of poll website shows.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Wong,Lilian Cheng
item.author: Natalie Wong,Lilian Cheng

item.title: Indonesian leader Joko Widodo’s US visit falls short – could China stand to benefit?
item.description: The recently signed US-Indonesia comprehensive strategic partnership shows the lack of potential for bilateral economic ties to deepen.
item.dc:creator: Amy Sood
item.author: Amy Sood

item.title: 14 people injured after Hong Kong coach mounts pavement, crashes into funeral parlour entrance
item.description: Police say bus was driving along Java Road in North Point before turning and crashing into entrance of Hong Kong Funeral Home.
item.dc:creator: Fiona Chow,Jeffie Lam
item.author: Fiona Chow,Jeffie Lam

item.title: Brazil police say British Airways crew lied about robbery to cover up alcohol and drugs binge
item.description: Three workers under investigation for falsely reporting a crime after claiming they were victims of an armed robbery in Rio de Janeiro.
item.dc:creator: Business Insider
item.author: Business Insider
